snippet: The season has been particularly bad for older people, but appears to have peaked, with reports of new cases declining in most of the nation.
abstract: Thomas R Frieden, director of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, says this year's flu season appears to be worse than average and particularly bad for elderly; adds season seems to have peaked, with new cases declining over most of nation.
lead_paragraph: The season has been particularly bad for older people, but appears to have peaked, with reports of new cases declining in most of the nation.

headline.seo: Flu Season ‘Worse Than Average,’ Officials Say
headline.main: Tough Flu Season in U.S., Especially for the Elderly
headline.print_headline: Tough Flu Season in U.S., Especially for the Elderly

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
